com.camerontec.util.logsreplication.server

Class LogsReplicationServerHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.util.spring.components.base.BaseComponentWithName
      • com.camerontec.util.spring.components.base.BaseComponentWithLogger
        • com.camerontec.util.spring.components.base.BaseComponentWithLifeCycle
          • com.camerontec.util.spring.components.base.BaseComponent
            • com.camerontec.util.logsreplication.server.LogsReplicationServerHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IHasLifeCycle, IHasName, org.springframework.beans.factory.Aware, org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanNameAware

    public class LogsReplicationServerHandler
extends BaseComponent
    Implementation of the replication server. Receives requests from clients and pushes data to clients.

    A thread pool is created to service client requests for data, the data is pushed to the client until an end of file is reached at which point the connection is disconnected and the thread returned to the pool. Compression of the stream is supported.

      • submitPush

        public void submitPush(DirectorySnapshotHandler directorySnapshotHandler,
                       String directoryPath,
                       String fileName,
                       long offset,
                       String connectionAddress,
                       int connectionPort,
                       int connectionToken)
        A request to push data back to a client. The client, filename and position in the file to push data from are specified.
        Parameters:
        directorySnapshotHandler - Manages whether or not a server should continue watching a particular directory.
        directoryPath - Specifies the directory path where the file is located.
        fileName - The name of the file to push data from.
        offset - The offset within the file to push data from.
        connectionAddress - The connection address of the client.
        connectionPort - The connection port of the client.
        connectionToken - A connection token inserted at the beginning of the stream.
